body.p: To the Governors of the several loyal States

The undersigned would hereby respectfully recommend to Your Excellencies Washington Irving Gilbert Esq a practicing Attorney of this City as properly qualified and every way worthy to be appointed a Commissioner to take Acknowledgements, Depositions &c in the District of Columbia for the several loyal States of the Union in accordance with their respective Laws and Usages, believing that such appointment would conduce to the convenience and interests of many loyal citizens of said States

U.S. Senators
John Sherman
J. H. Lane
B. F Harding
W. A. Richardson
S. C. Pomroy
L. W. Powell
H. S. Lane
S. A. McDougall
J. B. Henderson

Washington Irving Gilbert being duly sworn upon oath states that the above is a true copy of the original recommendation now in his possession and of the genuine signatures of the fifteen United States Senators and eighteen Members of Congress thereunto annexed
Sworn and subscribed before me (and original exhibited) this 18th day of March A. D. 1863

figure.ab:
DANIEL ROWLAND,
NOTARY
PUBLIC.
WASHINGTON CO. D. C.

body.p:
I most cheerfully concur in the foregoing recommendation of our fellow=citizen W. I.
Gilbert Esq and would add that his appointment as Commissioner of Deeds for this District by Your Excellency would commode many citizens from your State and would be gratifying to his many personal freinds.

Richard Wallach
Mayor of Washington D. C.

To His Excellency James F. Robinson
Governor of the State of Kentucky
I hereby certify the above to be ^a copy of^the genuine signature of His Honor Richard Wallach the present Mayor of this City as affixed to the original of this recommendation

Washington D. C.
March 18th 1863
Daniel Rowland
Notary Public
